title: Covenant Renewal and Joshua’s Death
summary: Joshua 24 recounts a covenant renewal at Shechem. Joshua recounts Israel’s history, challenges the people to serve the Lord alone, and famously declares, 'As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.' The book ends with Joshua’s death and burial.

faq.question: What choice does Joshua present to the people?
faq.answer: Choose today whom you will serve—either the gods of the past or the Lord.

faq.question: How does the book end?
faq.answer: With Joshua’s death and burial, and the bones of Joseph being laid to rest in Shechem.
